docs.text: edward burns tackles his third picture with no looking back , and like his previous two , it is a working-class relationship picture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , unlike his previous work , the film dwells on a more personal story , and with a female protagonist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and in no looking back , he stumbles , making a slow , boring film without the spark that enlivened his previous work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: claudia ( lauren holly ) is a small town waitress who is feeling stifled by her life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she's at a turning point in her life , and feels as if she's going nowhere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: her boyfriend , michael ( jon bon jovi ) , is broke and in a dead end job .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if she were to marry him , she'd never get a chance to escape this town .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: enter charlie ( edward burns ) , claudia's old flame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he skipped town several years before , without any explanations . . . even
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for claudia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he has come back to town to see her , and suddenly she is torn .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: should she stay with stable michael , and never escape her hometown . . . or
docs.label: negative

docs.text: should she ignore her instincts and fall for charlie again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: part of the answer lies in the character of her mother ( blythe danner ) , who fell for the wrong man . . . and has spent her life pining for claudia's father to return .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now it seems that claudia is about to make the same mistakes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at only a little past ninety minutes , no looking back is rather short for its genre .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , it seems much much longer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the storyline is simple and uninspired , and there's a lack of energy to the whole proceedings , which makes the entire drama rather tedious .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: edward burns makes a misstep by casting himself in the crucial role as the egomaniacal old flame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's no one to restrain his ego , which reigns unchecked .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he walks into the room and lauren holly swoons . . . yeah ,
docs.label: negative

docs.text: right .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lauren holly does what she can with her central character .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but we never understand why her character makes such pathetically bad decisions . . . and
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we never really care .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: bon jovi is the only sympathetic character in the whole movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his acting talents are much greater than they might seem , but he is given a mostly bland and ineffective role to work with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's not much to recommend in no looking back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not that the film is bad . . . it's
docs.label: negative

docs.text: simply boring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's no zest in any aspect of the film , and no reason to spend ninety minutes watching it .
docs.label: negative
